article-level-annotations.notes: Republicans voices are heard, and also questioning Democrats

phrase-level-annotations.txt: the controversial Trans Pacific Partnership trade proposal that has splintered Obama from House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., and rank-and-file Democrats

phrase-level-annotations.speaker: other_neutral
phrase-level-annotations.txt: didn't "weigh in on the secretive TPP deal that could depress American wages and cost American jobs."
Republican leaders generally support Obama's trade proposal and have suggested they may try to revive the bill as early as this week.
While Clinton called the pact the "gold standard" of trade agreements while serving as secretary of state, she has refused to take a position on the deal since announcing her candidacy.

phrase-level-annotations.speaker: other_anti
phrase-level-annotations.txt: "This is someone who has voted for trade agreements when they have been good for the country and against trade agreements when she thought they were bad for the country."
questioned Clinton's refusal to say where she stood

phrase-level-annotations.speaker: other_anti
phrase-level-annotations.txt: "By waffling on a trade deal she helped negotiate and once called a "gold standard," Hillary Clinton continues to show why voters overwhelmingly see her as dishonest and untrustworthy,"
